intro: Hedeoma tenuiflora, commonly known as narrow-flowered hedeoma, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It has a taproot system and is often found in disturbed soils. Hedeoma tenuiflora is not commonly cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and unique morphological features.
